TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract serializable beforefieldinit ResourcePermissionBase extends System.Security.CodeAccessPermission implements class System.Security.Permissions.IUnrestrictedPermission

Docs.summary: Allows control of code access security permissions.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > The ResourcePermissionBase class compares strings using ordinal sort rules and ignores the case of the strings being compared.
## Examples The following example inherits from the ResourcePermissionBase class. 4 kinds of constructors are implemented. The example also provides an implementation of a class called `MailslotPermissionEntry`. The <xref:System.Security.Permissions.ResourcePermissionBase.PermissionAccessType%2A> property is then privately set to the type of `MailslotPermissionEntry`. The <xref:System.Security.Permissions.ResourcePermissionBase.TagNames%2A> property is set privately to "Name" and "Machine".
[!code-cpp[ResourcePermissionBase#1](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/t-system.security.permis_0_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[ResourcePermissionBase#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.security.permis_0_1.vb)] [!code-cs[ResourcePermissionBase#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.security.permis_0_1.cs)]

Docs.permission: for the right to control evidence. Security action: . Associated enumeration: .

Docs.summary: Adds a permission entry to the permission.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example shows the use of the AddPermissionAccess method to add a permission access entry during class initialization. This code example is part of a larger example provided for the <xref:System.Security.Permissions.ResourcePermissionBase> class.
[!code-cpp[ResourcePermissionBase#2](~/add/codesnippet/cpp/dfef5eb6-165b-4033-bd02-_1.cpp)] [!code-vb[ResourcePermissionBase#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/dfef5eb6-165b-4033-bd02-_1.vb)] [!code-cs[ResourcePermissionBase#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/dfef5eb6-165b-4033-bd02-_1.cs)]

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value of this field is "*".

Docs.summary: Creates and returns an identical copy of the current permission object.
Docs.returns: A copy of the current permission object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A copy of the permission object represents the same access to resources as the original permission object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig instance class System.Security.Permissions.ResourcePermissionBaseEntry[] GetPermissionEntries() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns an array of the objects added to this permission.
Docs.returns: An array of objects that were added to this permission.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use <xref:System.Security.Permissions.ResourcePermissionBase.AddPermissionAccess%2A> and <xref:System.Security.Permissions.ResourcePermissionBase.RemovePermissionAccess%2A> to add and remove permission entries to this permission.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.IPermission Intersect(class System.Security.IPermission target) cil managed

Docs.param: A permission object of the same type as the current permission object.
Docs.summary: Creates and returns a permission object that is the intersection of the current permission object and a target permission object.
Docs.returns: A new permission object that represents the intersection of the current object and the specified target. This object is if the intersection is empty.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The intersection of two permission objects is a permission that describes the set of operations they both hold in common. Specifically, it represents the minimum permissions required for a demand to pass both permissions.

Docs.exception: The target permission object is not of the same type as the current permission object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance bool IsSubsetOf(class System.Security.IPermission target) cil managed

Docs.param: A permission object that is to be tested for the subset relationship.
Docs.summary: Determines whether the current permission object is a subset of the specified permission.
Docs.returns: if the current permission object is a subset of the specified permission object; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The current permission object is a subset of the specified permission object if the current permission object specifies a set of operations that is wholly contained by the specified permission object. For example, a permission that represents access to C:\Example.txt is a subset of a permission that represents access to C:\\. If this method returns `true`, the current permission object represents no more access to the protected resource than does the specified permission object.
This method always returns `false` when the specified permission object is of a different type than that of the current permission object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool IsUnrestricted() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the permission is unrestricted.

remarks.format: ## Remarks An unrestricted permission object represents access to any and all resources protected by the permission.

Docs.summary: Specifies the character to be used to represent a local reference.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value of this field is ".".

Docs.summary: Gets or sets an enumeration value that describes the types of access that you are giving the resource.
Docs.value: An enumeration value that is derived from <xref:System.Type> and describes the types of access that you are giving the resource.
Docs.exception: The property value is not an enumeration value.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets an array of strings that identify the resource you are protecting.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.SecurityElement ToXml() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates and returns an XML encoding of the security object and its current state.
Docs.returns: An XML encoding of the security object, including any state information.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Security.IPermission Union(class System.Security.IPermission target) cil managed

Docs.param: A permission object to combine with the current permission object. It must be of the same type as the current permission object.
Docs.summary: Creates a permission object that combines the current permission object and the target permission object.
Docs.returns: A new permission object that represents the union of the current permission object and the specified permission object.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The result of a call to Union is a permission that represents all the operations represented by both the current permission object and the specified permission object. Any demand that passes either permission passes their union.

Docs.exception: The permission object is not of the same type as the current permission object.
